main event: A ground object, the size of a grounded car, hovered at an altitude of 200 to 300 feet, and had an irregular motion, inversion present.
interesting points: The object appeared to move slowly and/or erratically, with at least 15-20 directional changes to the right and left within the observation period.
The object was described as not appearing to be a typical star, planet, or aircraft.
The case was considered as potentially being an astronomical object (star or planet).
The object was described as being brighter than a star.
The object was observed for 4-5 minutes, moving back and forth and vertically.
